intro: Conyza excisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is known for its wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza excisa is considered a weed in agricultural settings but has ecological value in supporting pollinators.
